prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: ALESS redshifts - z=4.1-4.7
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band 7 spectral scans of 21 ALESS SMGs to search for CII157um emission between z=4.1 and z=4.7

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Science goal 1: spectral scan 335-365GHz (z=4.23-4.70)
Is there a significant population of high-redshift SMGs (z>4), what is their volume density and [C II] luminosity function? This driving question necessitates us to observe all 21 of the z>4 candidates in our sample.
We have already demonstrated the feasibility of this project through the serendipitous detection of [C II] emission in two ALMA LESS SMGs (both of which were 2-min integrations). We therefore adopt the same strategy, making use of the improvement in sensitivity in Cycle 3 to yield strong and unambiguous detections of the emission lines.
From the MAIN ALESS SMG catalog, there are 24 SMGs with photometric redshifts of z>4. Three of these SMGs have already been spectroscopically confirmed as z~4.5 via detection of [C II] (Coppin et al. 2009; Swinbank et al. 2012; Nagao et al. 2012). We therefore propose 870-um observations of the remaining 21 ALMA SMGs.
We will use the C34-1 configuration (synthesised beam of 1.1'', which is well matched to our Cycle 0 ALESS maps).
In this science goal, we will use a spectral scans to search for [C II] over the redshift range z=4.23-4.70 (frequency settings f=335-365GHz).
To be consistent with our Cycle 0 data, we aim for an r.m.s. of 0.3mJy/beam in band 7 (or equivalently an r.m.s. of 4.5mJy per 31MHz channel). For an emission line of width 130-350km/s, this is sufficient to detect the [C II] emission line with a S/N>5 even for the faintest 870mu sources.
The ALMA sensitivity calculator suggests that a spectral scan of all 18 pointings required to cover 21 targets takes 2.17-hours (including overheads) for the frequency range f=335-365GHz.

We will use the same correlator setup as our cycle 0 program in which we successfully detected the [C II] in two of the ALESS SMGs. The channel width, 31MHz, is also idealy suited to resolving the emission line FWHM.

We are searching for [C II] emission in high-redshift galaxies which have angular sizes of approximately 1". We will thefore use the C34-1 configuration, which is also well matched to our cycle 0 observations.

prj:ScienceGoal.prj:name: ALESS redshifts - z=5.2-5.7
prj:ScienceGoal.prj:note: Band 7 spectral scans of 21 ALESS SMGs to search for CII157um emission between z=5.2 and z=5.7

prj:TechnicalJustification.prj:justificationText:
Science goal 2: spectral scan 280-310GHz (z=5.16-5.82)
We will use the C34-1 configuration (synthesised beam of 1.1'', which is well matched to our Cycle 0 ALESS maps).
In this science goal, we will use a spectral scan to search for [C II] over the redshift range z=5.16-4.5.82 (frequency settings f=280-310 GHz).
To be consistent with our Cycle 0 data, we aim for an r.m.s. of 0.3mJy/beam in band 7 (or equivalently an r.m.s. of 4.5mJy per 31MHz channel). For an emission line of width 130-350km/s, this is sufficient to detect the [C II] emission line with a S/N>5 even for the faintest 870mu sources.
The ALMA sensitivity calculator suggests that a spectral scan of all 18 pointings required to cover 21 targets takes 1.94-hours for the frequency range f=280-310GHz
The total time request for this proposal for both science goals is 2.17 + 1.94 = 4.11hours.

We will ise the same correlator setup as our cycle 0 program in which we successfully detected the [C II] intwo of the ALESS SMGs. The channel width, 3MHz, is also ideally suited to resolving the emission line FWHM.

We are searching for [C II] emission in high redshift galaxies that have angular sizes of approximately 1". We will therefore use the C34-1 configuration, which is also well matched to our cycle 0 observations.

prp:ObsProposal.prp:abstract:
We propose to search for the redshifted [C II]157.7um emission in a sample of 21 ALMA-identified SMGs in the Extended Chandra Deep Field South from the ALESS survey.
These SMGs have photometric redshifts of z>4 and all are "red-peakers" with SPIRE 500/350>1 colours. We will use two band 7 spectral scans, f=335-365GHz and f=280-310GHz to cover the redshift range z=4.23-4.7 and z-5.16-5.82 respectively.
Our primary science goals are to:
i) search for the [CII] emission in order to measure spectroscopic redshifts for these SMGs and so measure their bolometric luminosities and hence the contribution of z>4 SMGs to the comoving star formation density at this epoch
ii) derive the bright end of the CII luminosity function at z=4 and test how this compares to z=0 and z=2.
iii) measure the ratio of CII/FIR in a well selected sample of high-z ULIRGs to test whether the "CII" deficit is ubiquitous at high-redshift.
iv) search for signs of extended CII emission in the observations to place constraintynamical masses which can be compared to gas and stellar mass estimates.
The total time request for this program is 4.11 hours.
prp:ObsProposal.prp:relatedProposals: 2013.1.00250.S; PI: Swinbank. "A Redshift Survey of ALMA SMGs at z>4 from ALESS".
prp:ObsProposal.prp:scientificCategoryString: Cosmology and the High Redshift Universe

prp:CoInvestigator.prp:organisation: Dept of Astronomy & Astrophysics, Pennsylvania State University
